laboratory_examinations.findings: Reticular pattern of hypoauto-fluorescence in the superior macula, focal hyperauto-fluorescence corresponding to drusen, and tiny hypoauto-fluorescent dots resembling ground pepper scattered throughout the central macula.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At last registered clinical evaluation, presence of drusen mostly in peripheral macula and absence of central macular atrophy noted.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Angiographic evidence of nonexudative type 1 MNV with poorly defined staining throughout the central macula.
B-scans showed shallow irregular retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) detachment without evidence of exudation.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 1 year before death, area of MNV measured 13.70 mm²; showed SIRE maintained a consistent appearance over time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Small asymptomatic subretinal hemorrhage observed in the superior temporal macula.
No evidence of macular exudation in either eye.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Best-corrected visual acuity was 20/200 in the right eye and 20/30 in the left eye.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Presence of drusen mostly in peripheral macula and absence of central macular atrophy.

laboratory_examinations.date: 10 years, 8 years, and 1 year before patient death.
laboratory_examinations.findings: Total area of SIRE measured by a retina specialist. The area of MNV was 13.70 mm².
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Growth rate of MNV was 0.26 mm²/year over 9 years.
